definition: bubble/foam/blister (i.e. skin bubble)/to soak/to steep/to infuse/to dawdle/to shilly-shally/to hang about/to pick up (a girl)/to get off with (a sexual partner)/classifier for occurrences of an action/classifier for number of infusions
puffed/swollen/spongy/small lake (esp. in place names)/classifier for urine or feces
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

sentences.english: The property is empty changing is Japan " bubble economy " one of main show.
sentences.chinese: 產業空洞化是日本“泡沫經濟”的重要表現之一。

sentences.english: China in late 2007 has all the marks of a bubble economy.
sentences.chinese: 2007年下半年的中國有着各種泡沫經濟的標誌。

sentences.english: The pre-crisis UK economy, he says, was a “bubble economy”.
sentences.chinese: 他表示，危機前的英國經濟是一個“泡沫經濟”。

definition: subprime mortgage crisis/abbr. for 次級房屋信貸危機|次级房屋信贷危机[ci4 ji2 fang2 wu1 xin4 dai4 wei1 ji1]
